alert.note: Alert for Dewey (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 08 at 6:25PM CDT until July 08 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN DEWEY COUNTY... At 625 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Taloga to 4 miles southwest of Camargo, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Taloga, Leedey, Camargo and Putnam. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
